Dow sells off more than 700 points on trade war fears 4:58 PM ET Thu, 22 March 2018 | 03:46

U.S. stocks fell sharply on Thursday, pressured by worries of a potential trade war and a decline in tech shares.
The 30-stock index also briefly entered correction territory for the first time since last month, falling 10 percent from its 52-week high at one point late in the day.
The Dow Jones industrial average dropped 724.42 points to close at 23,957.89, with Caterpillar, 3M and Boeing as the biggest decliners.
Financials was the worst-performing sector in the index plunging 3.7 percent, its worst day since Feb. 8 when it dropped 4.5 percent.
The S&P 500 fell 2.5 percent to 2,643.69, with seven of 11 sectors — including tech and financials — dropping more than 2 percent.
Selling intensified into the close with the Dow losing more than 250 points in the final hour of trading.
The Nasdaq composite pulled back 2.3 percent to close at 7,166.68.
The broader market was also pressured by a decline in bank stocks.
The 2.9 percent decline was the worst since Feb. 8.
